page.title: 05Landscape of Malhamdale
page.content: The landscape is very rural and is dominated by the limestone bedrock.It is interspersed with dry stone walls.Farmhouses are scattered at regular intervals parallel to the road,especially between Kirkby Malham and Airton. Some of the stone-built cottages date back to the 17th century,and many barns are older still.Most houses are large by modern standards. {Airton}developed around a village green,and by the River Aire there,an old wool-spinning mill has been converted into flats.{Scalegill Mill}, another disused wool-spinning mill by the river near Kirkby Malham,has also been converted into holiday cottages and flats. { }
